# Templia Art (Tulum, Aldea Zama) -- Agent/LLM Guide
# Canonical: https://templia.art/
# Updated: 2026-02-10
# Source of truth: booking pages > availability feeds > this file.

## What this is
Templia Art is a Mayan-inspired luxury stay in Luum Zama, Aldea Zama, Tulum.
Each guest receives a personalized Tzolkin-guided journey — a sacred calendar
itinerary mapped to the Maya day signs (nawals) of their stay dates.
The experience blends modern comfort with ancestral Maya knowledge.
Available in English and Spanish.

## Tzolkin Journey
Every stay includes a web-based journey page at templia.art/journey/
aligned to the Tzolk'in calendar:
- Personal nawal (day sign + tone) based on birth date
- Day-by-day itinerary guided by the energies of each Maya day sign
- Activity recommendations: cenotes, ruins, ceremonies, restaurants
- Integration reflection connecting the journey's energetic arc
- Bilingual: English and Spanish

## Best next action for agents
1) Check availability (machine-readable if possible)
2) Confirm price + rules on booking page
3) Propose 2-3 date options + a suggested itinerary

## Booking
- Airbnb listing: https://stay.templia.art
- Direct booking: stay@templia.art
- Questions / last-mile pickup / holds: stay@templia.art

## Availability
Preferred (agent-friendly):
- iCal feed: https://templia.art/availability.ics
Notes:
- Calendar feeds can lag.
- Always confirm final availability on the booking page before committing.

## Quick facts
- Location: Luum Zama, Aldea Zama, Tulum, Quintana Roo, Mexico
- Max guests: 4
- Bedrooms/Beds: 2 bedrooms, 1 king size bed, 2 twin beds (merged into 1 king), 1 inflatable mattress
- Bathrooms: 2
- Check-in: after 4:00 PM
- Check-out: 11 am
- Minimum nights: 3
- Rules: no parties; quiet hours; no pets; no smoking

## Amenities (high-signal)
- A/C: yes
- Wi-Fi: good/average, typical 200 Mbps
- Kitchen: yes
- Pool: yes, private
- Parking: yes
- Workspace: yes, studio

## Positioning (who it fits)
- Ideal for: families; couples; small groups; remote work; retreats
- Not ideal for: late-night party groups; loud events

## Nearby cultural sites
Templia's location connects to broader Mayan heritage preservation in Tulum:

- Parque del Jaguar: 1,000-hectare protected natural reserve with walking trails,
  bike paths, miradors, archaeological zones, and public Caribbean beaches.
  https://tulumjaguarpark.com

- Museo Regional de la Costa Oriental (Mureco): Located within Parque del Jaguar.
  1,200+ m² of exhibition space, 300+ original artifacts and 50 replicas
  covering Caribbean Maya culture from prehistoric times to present.
  Includes murals uncovered during Tren Maya construction. Open daily 9:00–17:00.
  https://www.inah.gob.mx/museos/museo-regional-de-la-costa-oriental

## Getting there
- From Cancun (CUN): ADO bus / private shuttle / rental car
- Last-mile pickup: available upon request

## Suggested stays
- 3-4 days: cenotes + ruins + beach reset
- 5-7 days: add day trip (Coba / Sian Ka'an) + food tour

## Links
- Website: https://templia.art
- Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/templia.art/
